title: Brave police officer puts his life on the line to save busload of children - 9news.com.au
text:
Brave police officer puts his life on the line to save busload of children By Adam Duggan 
A police officer has parked his patrol car in the path of an out-of-control truck to save a bus carrying 18 children that were travelling to a sporting competition. 
The truck was travelling from Astana, the capital of Kazakhstan, to Pavlodar, in the country's northeast, on Friday morning when the police officer noticed it was headed towards the bus. 
On board the bus were 18 children and four adults. 
So the police officer parked his car in front, risking the life of himself and his partner, according to RT . 
"A 50-year-old driver of a Kamaz (a Russian heavy vehicle manufacturer) truck turned the wheel into oncoming traffic," a statement issued by the Pavlodar Internal Affairs Department read. 
"In order to prevent the Kamaz from crashing into a bus with 18 children and four supervisors, chief police officer Murat Nurseitov without hesitation put his patrol car across the road." 
Vision filmed after the accident shows the completely destroyed police car. 
The car appears to have been hit with such impact that the windscreen popped out before smashing into pieces. 
Luckily, none of the children or their supervisors on the bus were injured. 
The truck driver was taken to hospital and placed in an induced coma, from which he has since woken up. 
Mr Nurseitov suffered serious injuries in the crash. 
His colleague, Bayanbek Zhunusov, suffered minor injuries and refused to go to hospital. 
Both police officers received $20,675 each as a reward for their bravery.
